item.title: Situation in Spain üá™üá∏ with COVID-19
item.description:
Coronavirus History in Spain üá™üá∏

The COVID-19 pandemic in Spain is part of the pandemic of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID‚Äë19). Spain has the second highest total confirmed cases in Europe after Russia. The first confirmed cases came from Germany and spread to Spain on 31 Jan 2019. Up to 15 March 2020, all 50 provinces have confirmed cases of the country. Spain became one of the most draconian countries in the world and a lockdown restriction imposed on 14 March 2020. Until 13 Sep, there are about 566,326 confirmed cases and 29,747 deaths WHO(Organization 2020).

Data Source and Descriptions üö®

The data is taken from the tidycovid19(Gassen 2020a) package üì¶ created by Joachim Gassen. The tidycovid19 package was created to provide transparent access to various data sources. Then, used download_merged_data to merge the dataset. This merge dataset contains data of coronavirus confirmed, recovered, death original collected from Johns Hopkins University(University 2020).Some other variables contains the frequency places are visited comes from Google Commmunity Mobility Reports(Google 2020). The second set of data comes from Bing(Bing 2020) which contains all the regions location and cases in Spain. The raw data was stored in two CSV files separately. The data collection date for this blog until September 13, 2020. The following map and plots present these variables in the data set and also contain descriptions.

Is data reflect the real situation? What caused the Coronavirus crisis in Spain? üó∫

Coronavirus crisis is one of the darkest and dramatic moments in recent Spanish history which the virus is spreading faster than any neighboring nation. From the Map 1 below, Madrid, the Spanish region with the highest number of cases, had the confirmed case of 81,047 in total. After that, Catalonia became the second highest number of cases up to 62,524 until September 13th.

Figure 1: Total Confirmed Cases in Each Region

However, this set of number does not show the full picture of Spain‚Äôs coronavirus crisis. Figure 2 does not present daily new cases for all regions, otherwise the plot will be extremely complex and hard to read. Cases for most days is zero or not available. Therefore, how the coronavirus outbreak is developing through the data is not accurate. ELPAIS(ELTAIS 2020) explain the potential reason for this situation. To be specific, the hospital üè• may spend more than one week to process person contracting the disease, some symptoms presents and ask for a test and getting the results. In this one-week period, this person did not get isolation and may have local transmission of the coronavirus began to increase. That‚Äôs why experts believe that the number of confirmed cases may be 10 times higher than what they have been reported.

Figure 2: Time serious of daily new cases in each region

What more, what caused the coronavirus in Spain to be a crisis? Guardian(Guardian 2020) gives two fundamental reasons.

  • Mundane: The main reason for the quick spread through Spain may be mundane. Hugging, kissing and animated chatter from other‚Äôs face in a few inches have become a commonplace thing.
  • Government: Other reason was the government reacted late and clumsily.

Since the financial crisis, Spain has been extremely fragile and this country lack essential equipment. During the crisis, protective clothing for doctors and coronavirus tests were still only just being sourced and China provided assistance within its capability to help Spain Xinhua(Xinhua 2020).

Due to coronavirus continued deterioration, the lockdown that began on 14 March enforced with police and popular pressure Guardian(Guardian 2020). The next following section will explore lockdown restriction to citizen daily activity frequency changes.

How lockdown restriction impact citizen daily activity? üë£

Countries around the world are in uncharted territory. The emergence and spread of COVID-19 has touched every facet of society. The Spain nationwide lockdown began at March 14, as a result, daily life comes to a halt, such as public gathering party are canceled, employees were sent back to home. All sizes of business are facing many uncertainties about their prospects.

The following Figure 3 and Figure 4 presents the changes of different activities regarding the lockdown restrictionsüîí. Up to now, stage four restrictions happened twice since the beginning of lockdown at March 14. Stage four was an advanced phase, in which the restriction was limited. More than 23,000 people have died in Spain after contracting coronavirus, making the country one of the worst affected in the world by the illness. At this period, thousands of employee were forced to work at home during nearly three-month coronavirus lockdown. Therefore, frequency that people visited workplaces has dropped about 50% compare with before. After the fourth stage lockdown restriction ended, employees allowed to work in the physical workplace and frequency that people visit workplaces increased, but still lower than the average rate. Remote working caused by coronavirus has made many people aware of the convenience. Besides, Spain government are protecting the rights of remote workers, such as distance working must be a voluntary choice or employees have the right to apply compensation for any direct or indirect costs related to remote work ELPAIS(ELPAIS 2020).

Figure 3: The frequency that people visit workplaces and residential relative to the baseline period Jan 3 - Feb 6, 2020.

Within the lockdown period, parks closed. Most of them transfer the outdoor sports to exercise at home. In Figure 4, people rarely visit parks during the lockdown period. At the end of April, it has seen a steadily declining number of cases per day, leading to the country‚Äôs plan to broaden lockdown restrictions. Spain has released an exit strategy from the lockdown restriction in a bid to return the normality, while keeping COVID-19 under control euronews(euronews 2020). With the gradual relaxation of the lockdown restriction, retail and recreation industry allowed to re-open to the public, such as sidewalk caf√© reopened and Spaniards can exercise outdoors CNN(Goodman 2020). As a consequence, frequency that people visit parks increase over than 50% which is higher than any other activities.

Figure 4: The frequency changes that people visit pharmacy, parks, retail and recreation relative to the baseline period Jan 3 - Feb 6, 2020

Overall, as the pandemic is under control, people‚Äôs travel frequency has gradually increased, especially for the outdoor activities. For now, Spain has decreased to the first level of lockdown, daily life gradually return to normal. However, face mask are now obligatory at ALL times and keep two meters social distance. Some regions such as Aragon Madrid and Catalu√±a are currently experiencing outbreaks that has brought back lockdown in some towns and regions. The government is also making regulations based on the current situation.

Acknowledgements

The packages used for producing this post are:

tidyverse (Wickham et al. 2019), knitr (Xie 2014), kableExtra (Zhu 2019), dplyr (Wickham et al. 2020), tidycovid19(Gassen 2020b), zoo(Zeileis and Grothendieck 2005), ggplot(Wickham 2016),scales(Wickham and Seidel 2020), highcharter(Kunst 2020), leaflet(Cheng, Karambelkar, and Xie 2019), lubridate(Grolemund and Wickham 2011).

The raw data comes from two github repositories: tidycovid19(Gassen 2020a) and Bing(Bing 2020).

References

ELTAIS. 2020. ‚ÄúSpain‚Äôs Coronavirus Crisis: Why the Numbers Are Failing to Show the Full Picture.‚Äù https://english.elpais.com/society/2020-04-05/spains-coronavirus-crisis-why-the-numbers-are-failing-to-show-the-full-picture.html.

euronews. 2020. ‚ÄúCoronavirus: Spain Reveals Four-Stage Plan to de-Escalate from Covid-19 Lockdown.‚Äù https://www.euronews.com/2020/04/29/coronavirus-spain-reveals-four-stage-plan-to-de-escalate-from-covid-19-lockdown.

Gassen, Joachim. 2020a. ‚ÄúDownload, Tidy and Visualize Covid-19 Related Data.‚Äù GitHub Repository. https://github.com/joachim-gassen/tidycovid19; GitHub.

Google. 2020. ‚ÄúSee How Your Community Is Moving Around Differently Due to Covid-19.‚Äù Google Community. https://www.google.com/covid19/mobility/; Google.

Grolemund, Garrett, and Hadley Wickham. 2011. ‚ÄúDates and Times Made Easy with lubridate.‚Äù Journal of Statistical Software 40 (3): 1‚Äì25. http://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/i03/.

Guardian. 2020. ‚ÄúHow Did Spain Get Its Coronavirus Response so Wrong?‚Äù https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/26/spain-coronavirus-response-analysisl.

Kunst, Joshua. 2020. Highcharter: A Wrapper for the ‚ÄôHighcharts‚Äô Library. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=highcharter.

Organization, World Health. 2020. ‚ÄúSpain Covid-19 Dashboard.‚Äù https://covid19.who.int/region/euro/country/es.

Wickham, Hadley, Mara Averick, Jennifer Bryan, Winston Chang, Lucy D‚ÄôAgostino McGowan, Romain Fran√ßois, Garrett Grolemund, et al. 2019. ‚ÄúWelcome to the tidyverse.‚Äù Journal of Open Source Software 4 (43): 1686. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686.

Wickham, Hadley, Romain Fran√ßois, Lionel Henry, and Kirill M√ºller. 2020. Dplyr: A Grammar of Data Manipulation. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=dplyr.

item.title: Canada COVID19 Post üá®üá¶
item.description:
About Canada üá®üá¶

Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID‚Äë19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The situation around the world still serious, and Canada is one of them. The virus was confirmed to spread Canada on January 25, 2020, after a citizen who had traveled ‚úàÔ∏è from Wuhan, Hubei to Toronto, tested positive. With government policies, such as restricting people‚Äôs travel and maintaining social distancing, the cases have declined significantly.

Data Source and Description üéØ

The dataset used in this post is from Isha Berry personal GitHub(Berry I 2020) and the data source is Canadian Medical Association Journal (CMAJ).

The COVID-19 data regarding Canada was collected by COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group on confirmed and positive cases. Each line in the dataset represents a unique cases. The original dataset also include information such as age, sex, history travel. The cases, death, recovered dataset were created since the first relevant event occurred. The raw data was stored in seven CSV files separately. The data collection date for this blog until August 27, 2020. The following tables and plots present these variables in the data set and also contain descriptions.

Each Province COVID-19 Details üîç

This interactive datatable concentrate on number of cumulative confirmed cases, daily new cases, cumulative deaths, daily new deaths and the number of recovered in each province and the whole Canada.

Numercial Summary Statistics üìÑ

Table 1 shows that numerical summary statistics of four variables: daily new cases, cumulative cases, daily new deaths and cumulative deaths. In the Max column, the max of daily new cases and daily new deaths represent the maximum value in a day since the COVID-19 spread to Canada, while the max of cumulative cases and cumulative deaths shows the latest results. At the end of the table, cases and deaths in Canada were declined significantly üìâ.

Stories behind the Data:

Although cases and deaths in Canada was declined obviously, the authenticity of the data is not accurate. Indigenous Canadians as the indigenous people within the boundaries of the Canada. Indigenous people in Canada take 4.9% of the whole national population. Regarding the CBC news, Indigenous Services Canada releases cumulative number of positive cases, but no data on deaths, recoveries regarding the news from CBC(CBC 2020). As a result, the histogram at the end of the Table 1 does not present a full picture of the indigenous communities. Besides, indigenous communities received inequitable measures from federal government. As of June 25, Canada‚Äôs specific measures to limit the spread of COVID-19 in First Nations communities in Canada represent less than one per cent of the federal government‚Äôs funding to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The Conversation(Conversation 2020).

Table 1: Numerical Summary Statistics in Canada
Variable Mean Min Q1 Q2 Q3 Max Hist
cases 773.80723 84 343.75 617.5 1196.75 2560 ‚ñá‚ñÉ‚ñÉ‚ñÇ‚ñÅ
cumulative_cases 79281.09036 341 46659.75 96145.5 111333.00 128709 ‚ñÉ‚ñÇ‚ñÇ‚ñÖ‚ñá
deaths 52.82081 0 6.00 22.0 96.00 229 ‚ñá‚ñÇ‚ñÇ‚ñÇ‚ñÅ
cumulative_deaths 5661.34104 1 1757.00 7456.0 8848.00 9138 ‚ñÉ‚ñÅ‚ñÅ‚ñÇ‚ñá

Explore the Relationship between Testing and Cases üìà

Only for personal interest ü§®, I want to explore the relationship between cases and testing. Since the first cases arrived in Canada in January 25, 2020, the government started to test from March 8, 2020. Therefore, I combine the testing data and cases data together and select all data from March 8 until now. In my personal prediction, with the development of testing, there will be more confirmed cases. In other words, these two variables have the positive relationship. However, from this combination graph, it could not find the relationship between cases and testing in Fig1. In addition, R-squared is 0.188 which is close to 0. Also represents if the cases and testing is linear regression, all the real data is far away from the line. The results regarding R-squared is show in Table 2. The reason they are not related may be that Canada has almost controlled the worsening of the COVID-19 in this period.

Figure 1: Relationship between testing and cases

Table 2: Summary of the relationship between testing and cases
r.squared adj.r.squared statistic p.value AIC BIC
0.1887101 0.1837632 38.14722 0 2520.831 2530.167

Acknowledgements

The packages used for producing this post are:

tidyverse (Wickham et al. 2019), broom (Robinson, Hayes, and Couch 2020), skimr (Waring et al. 2020), DT (Xie, Cheng, and Tan 2020), knitr (Xie 2014), kableExtra (Zhu 2019), dplyr (Wickham et al. 2020), lubridate(Grolemund and Wickham 2011).

Two news comes from: CBC(CBC 2020), The Conversation(Conversation 2020)

The raw data comes from Canada(Berry I 2020)

References

Berry I, Tuite A, Soucy J-PR. 2020. ‚ÄúCovid19Canada.‚Äù GitHub Repository. https://github.com/ishaberry/Covid19Canada; GitHub.

CBC. 2020. ‚ÄúData Gaps Exist on Covid-19 Cases in Indigenous Communities, Says Research Fellow.‚Äù https://www.cbc.ca/news/indigenous/coronavirus-indigenous-data-gap-1.5556676.

Conversation, The. 2020. ‚ÄúIndigenous Communities at Increased Risk During the Coronavirus Pandemic.‚Äù https://theconversation.com/indigenous-communities-at-increased-risk-during-the-coronavirus-pandemic-142027.

Grolemund, Garrett, and Hadley Wickham. 2011. ‚ÄúDates and Times Made Easy with lubridate.‚Äù Journal of Statistical Software 40 (3): 1‚Äì25. http://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/i03/.

Robinson, David, Alex Hayes, and Simon Couch. 2020. Broom: Convert Statistical Objects into Tidy Tibbles. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=broom.

Waring, Elin, Michael Quinn, Amelia McNamara, Eduardo Arino de la Rubia, Hao Zhu, and Shannon Ellis. 2020. Skimr: Compact and Flexible Summaries of Data. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=skimr.

Wickham, Hadley, Mara Averick, Jennifer Bryan, Winston Chang, Lucy D‚ÄôAgostino McGowan, Romain Fran√ßois, Garrett Grolemund, et al. 2019. ‚ÄúWelcome to the tidyverse.‚Äù Journal of Open Source Software 4 (43): 1686. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686.

Wickham, Hadley, Romain Fran√ßois, Lionel Henry, and Kirill M√ºller. 2020. Dplyr: A Grammar of Data Manipulation. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=dplyr.

Xie, Yihui. 2014. ‚ÄúKnitr: A Comprehensive Tool for Reproducible Research in R.‚Äù In Implementing Reproducible Computational Research, edited by Victoria Stodden, Friedrich Leisch, and Roger D. Peng. Chapman; Hall/CRC. http://www.crcpress.com/product/isbn/9781466561595.

Xie, Yihui, Joe Cheng, and Xianying Tan. 2020. DT: A Wrapper of the Javascript Library ‚ÄôDatatables‚Äô. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DT.

Zhu, Hao. 2019. KableExtra: Construct Complex Table with ‚ÄôKable‚Äô and Pipe Syntax. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=kableExtra.
